node.title: Nike's metaverse includes NFT shoes for a virtual world
node.description: Sports apparel giant launched Nikeland last month and now owns a studio known for making virtual shoes.

node.title: 3-year-old died in his mother's arms during Kentucky tornado
node.description: The woman's 1-year-old son, who was also in her arms, survived and was not injured.

node.title: Shirley McBay, Pioneering Mathematician, Is Dead at 86
node.description: The first Black student to receive a doctorate from the University of Georgia, she devoted her life to advocating for diversity in science and math education.

node.title: After a School Shooting, Should Parents Be Prosecuted?
node.description: A Michigan prosecutor hopes the strategy can prevent more school shootings. But some on both sides of the gun control debate are wary.

node.title: Pfizer’s Covid Pill Works Well, Company Confirms in Final Analysis
node.description: The treatment, called Paxlovid, is likely to work against Omicron and could be available in the United States before the end of the year.

node.title: Senators Question Califf, the F.D.A. Nominee, on Opioid Crisis and Pandemic Response
node.description: A Senate panel hearing on Tuesday signaled that Dr. Robert Califf, who briefly led the agency during the Obama administration, had some bipartisan support.

node.title: Judge Clarifies Order on New York Times Coverage of Project Veritas
node.description: The decision allows some latitude for reporting until a final ruling is reached. The Times said the order remained “an unconstitutional prior restraint that should be dissolved.”

node.title: Three jailed in Greece after a principal was handcuffed over virus measures.
node.description: Police said a group of people handcuffed the principal on Friday and drove him to a local precinct, suggesting that officers arrest him for enforcing Covid measures.

node.title: 100-Pound African Tortoise Spotted on a Stroll Down a Pennsylvania Street
node.description: "This big old turtle just wanted to go for a walk and be free," the officer that found the creature said. "Still not sure where he got loose from."

node.title: Boston Starbucks Employees Looking to Piggyback on Buffalo Unionization Start Process
node.description: Employees at two Boston Starbucks stores are looking to be represented by Workers United Labor Union, the same union looking to represent the Buffalo Starbucks.

node.title: Only Small Fraction of Arts Funders Required Actors Earn Living Wage Before Pandemic
node.description: From 2019 to 2020, the unemployment rate of actors jumped from nearly 25 percent to more than 52 percent, according to the National Endowment for the Arts.

node.title: NFL Coaches, Staff Must Get COVID Booster Shots by Dec. 27 as Dozens of Players Sidelined
node.description: "Given the increased prevalence of the virus in our communities, our experts have recommended that we implement the CDC's recommendation," the NFL wrote.
